com.fsck.k9.mail: provides utility methods for determining whether an email message failed permanently or not.
"provides methods to check the status of debugging sensitive information".
"facilitates debugging by providing methods to control the enabled state and sensitivity of debug output."
provides methods to write, access, and modify email parts.
provides a set of methods to open, close, and send a message via the transport layer of the K-9 Mail Android app.
provides methods for checking email store settings, getting folders, sending and copying messages, and checking push and seen flag support.
provides methods to parse, encode, pack, unpack, and manipulate email addresses and associated personal details.
provides various authentication methods, including XOAUTH, CRAM-MD5, and base64 encoding.
provides methods for writing, retrieving, and setting the content transfer encoding for an email message body.
provides methods for handling exceptions related to the validation of digital certificates.
generates random strings to be used as boundaries in emails.
provides an abstract representation of an email body part which can be used to set and get its encoding, parent, and extra information from the server.
"converts between transport-specific URIs and ServerSettings objects."
creates a Body instance from an InputStream with a content transfer encoding and content type.
allows any class implementing the interface to be notified upon the completion of retrieving and/or starting to retrieve messages from a mail server.
creates a `com.fsck.k9.mail.Body` object from given content transfer encoding, content type, and input stream.
provides an interface for performing periodic synchronization of email folders for push services.
allows users to control the debug status and debug-sensitive information display of an email client.
provides a set of methods for storing and manipulating information about server settings.
"allows a client to control the sensitivity and enabled state of a `K9MailLib$WritableDebugStatus` object".
provides several methods for creating and accessing transport-related objects.
provides methods to update, synchronize, and receive push notifications for a given folder.
defines a set of constants for different types of Internet network connections.
provides an interface for constructing MIME-formatted messages composed of multiple parts.
provides methods for setting and retrieving data from a mail message, such as the body, flags, headers, and the sender/recipient information.
"provides a way to store and access an X509Certificate chain".
provides methods for manipulating mail providers, folders, messages, and their properties.
com.fsck.k9.mail.filter: allows the encoding and decoding of data in Base64 format.
copies input bytes to an output stream, doubling any dots that follow a carriage return.

:

"Wraps lines of text and writes them to an output stream, flushing the buffered characters when needed."
allows for tracking and transitioning between different states of a SignSafeOutputStream stream.
provides a method to convert an array of bytes to an array of characters representing the hexadecimal values of each byte.
counts the number of bytes that have been written to an output stream.
provides a set of methods which can be used to encode and decode data in the base64 format.
provides an input stream class that allows for peeking at the next byte without advancing the pointer.
converts any Windows-style line endings (CR+LF) to single Unix line endings (LF) and flushes the output stream.
provides methods for reading and skipping bytes from a given input stream.
provides an output stream used to safely encode and write data to another output stream.
com.fsck.k9.mail.helper: provides methods that can encode and decode strings in UTF-8 format.
com.fsck.k9.mail.internet: extracts list post addresses from a given Message object.
provides methods for writing and reading data from a binary file in a temporary directory.
enables users to set the character set for a mail part and also looks for a variant of a JIS encoded address and returns the corresponding shift_jis-2007 charset if it exists, or UTF-8 if it doesn't.
encodes text into an encoded word or a sequence of encoded words with a suitable charset.
provides methods to detect the JIS variant of an email address or a message.
allows users to manipulate headers in a MIME message.
reads and converts ISO 2022 Japanese text to Shift-JIS character encoding.
provides an input stream implementation for body parts backed by a temporarily created file that can be closed without deleting it.
provides a way to access the underlying internet `Part` associated with a `Textual` instance.
builds a MimeMessage object from header-fields, bodies, and content-types.
provides a static method for generating a message ID based on the hostname of the sender for a given message.
helps extract text from email messages as well as viewable files and attachment parts.
provides methods to access, set, and write header information, body content, and content types for MimeBodyPart objects.
decodes encoded words in strings according to RFC 2047.
provides methods for decoding, encoding, and manipulating MIME types and associated data.
creates and stores MimeHeader fields with names and values, and can generate toString representations of them.
provides a set of methods for manipulating and retrieving data from a MIME message.
provides methods to retrieve text, HTML and alternative Viewable objects.
provides methods to modify Part objects by setting their encoding and body.
provides a way to get the value of the `delSp` field.
allows users to set the content-transfer-encoding for a message/rfc822 body.
provides a method to retrieve the encoding of raw data contained in a body of an email message.
creates MIME multipart objects, with various operations for setting the preamble, boundary, subtype, and epilogue of the object.
provides functionality to determine the size of an object.
provides methods that allow users to manipulate text bodies, such as setting the encoding, retrieving raw text, or getting the size.
"provides methods to get the associated message and the container part of the Viewable."
com.fsck.k9.mail.message: handles the raw message headers and body parts for use in a message receiver.
parses and assigns expected headers to a given mail message part.
com.fsck.k9.mail.oauth: parses an OAuth2 challenge response and determines if a retry is needed.

provides methods for authorizing API access, getting accounts suitable for OAuth 2.0 token provision, getting tokens with a time limit before expiry, and invalidating previously saved tokens for a given username.
provides a callback for OAuth 2.0 authentication, which either succeeds or fails.
com.fsck.k9.mail.power: provides a wake lock with logging and notification to monitor the acquire and release of the lock.
provides an interface to create and acquire wake locks for tracking power management operations.
com.fsck.k9.mail.ssl: creates a secure and trusted socket connection for sending and receiving emails.
provides an implementation of the X509TrustManager interface to verify server certificates and determine if they should be trusted.
provides an API for managing a local SSL certificate key store.
provides alias-based key selection and management methods for working with a key chain in an SSL/TLS network connection.
provides a secure socket for communication to a specific host on a given port using a specific client certificate alias.
generates a SecureX509TrustManager instance based on the specified host and port.
com.fsck.k9.mail.store.imap: parses an ImapResponse and creates a set of flags that indicates whether keywords can be created or not.
provides methods for manipulating an IMAP message, such as setting flags and deleting it.
stores settings for the ImapStore in order to establish a connection with an IMAP server.

:

Parses IMAP SEARCH responses and returns a list of numbers.
enables users to parse IMAP responses and return an object with the literal string found therein.
reads an IMAP response from an input stream and provides a callback object for handling the response.
provides a way to parse a push state string and obtain an ImapPushState object.
creates an ImapStore URI based on the supplied server settings.
"parses IMAP namespace responses and provides getter methods to retrieve its namespace prefix and hierarchy delimiter".
extracts an IMAP response code from an `ImapResponse` object.
enables users to connect to an IMAP server, send commands, read responses, and close connections.
parses an IMAP response and returns an instance indicating whether the current mode is read-only or read-write.
provides utility methods for dealing with IMAP protocol operations.
allows users to define the connection and authentication settings for an IMAP server connection.
provides a class that stores response tags, command continuation requests, and callback handlers for handling IMAP server responses.
provides a way to process and store IMAP data, such as content types and transfer encodings, into a Body object.
provides access to the settings associated with an IMAP store, such as the port, host, username, password, connection security type, authentication type, and path delimiter.
provides an automated way to push emails to an IMAP folder.
parses ImapStore URIs and converts them into ImapStoreSettings.
stores the message associated with a given UID by parsing the ImapResponse and the FixedLengthInputStream.
handles and manages automatic refreshes of IMAP folders.
stops the idle process of an IMAP folder pusher by setting the `acceptDoneContinuation` flag to false and sending a done signal.
"provides a means for capturing an IMAP error response from the server and accessing the last response and associated alert text".
provides a way to encode and decode folder names from and to a modified UTF-7 charset.
parses IMAP responses and provides the capabilities of the IMAP server.
provides a method for searching an IMAP server and returning a list of search results.
provides a method to extract an alert message from an IMAP response.
provides methods to access, retrieve, and manipulate data from an ImapList object.
provides a callback for asynchronous handling of untagged IMAP responses.
provides methods to access and manipulate an IMAP folder.
provides a connection to an IMAP server and enables the manipulation of its associated folders.
handles asynchronous responses from an IMAP server and sends out notifications while looping and allowing for repetitive errors.
parses a provided ImapResponse object and returns a mapping of source UIDs to destination UIDs.
parses a list of ImapResponses and returns a list of ListResponses with associated hierarchy delimiter and attributes.
com.fsck.k9.mail.store.pop3: generates a formatted string of the enabled POP3 features for a given server.

:

Reads characters from an input stream and checks whether the end of the line has been reached.
provides methods for creating, decoding and checking an encoded Pop3Store URI, as well as getting a Pop3Folder and a list of Folder objects that contain the inbox folder name.
provides methods to manipulate Pop3 mail messages.
provides methods for interacting with a POP3 email folder, such as retrieving messages, creating folders, deleting messages, etc.
com.fsck.k9.mail.store.webdav: "provides methods to manage message data covers such as Message UIDs, URLs, special folder names and Read Status".
modifies and executes HttpUriRequests with the ability to accept and decode gzipped responses.
provides a factory for creating instances of the `WebDavHttpClient` class.
provides methods for creating and getting information from a WebDavStoreSettings object, which stores data related to a WebDav-based mail store.
"parses and stores webDAV requests and responses".
creates a WebDavStore URI based on the server settings provided.
provides a mechanism to parse and decode WebDavStore URIs into an object (`WebDavStoreSettings`) containing all relevant information.
provides a utility to generate and set HTTP request methods.
enables the manipulation and storage of messages in a WebDAV store.
provides methods for getting, setting, and adding message headers to a parsed message envelope.
provides the ability to retrieve messages, append messages, create a folder, get the URL, delete messages, move or copy messages, and open the WebDAV folder in a specified mode with the `HttpClient`.
provides methods for creating an SSL socket and for connecting it to a host using specified parameters.
provides methods for authentication, decoding, sending, and retrieving folders, as well as other operations related to webdav communications.
com.fsck.k9.mail.store: provides an interface that enables applications to manage remote mail stores and their associated credentials.
provides methods to configure different elements of a mail store.
